name: DA Coursework 2017 - Basketball Prediction
tagline: Repository for Data Analytics Course Work materials
body:
### Welcome to NCAA Basketball Tournament Prediction Analysis
This is a page provided by GitHub to present our project related with analysis of the games played during the famous NCAA College Basketball Tournament played each year in March in USA.
This is a MSc course group project from the Data Analytics module at Queen Mary University.

### The team
We love machine learning, big data and sports. When you combine them what do you get? - Sports Analytics.
We build this team not only with the idea to get a good note for the degree, but to learn, improve and challenge ourselves.
Here we are
- Yuan-Yi Chang
- Ivaylo Shalev [iviglious.blogspot.com](http://iviglious.blogspot.co.uk/)
- Ziqi Zhao

### The tournament

### The approach

### The results
From all 60+ games played between 68 teams our model managed to predict 46 accurately.

### Thanks
We would like to thank our teachers and instructors at QMUL.  
We are grateful for the patience and support of our families and loved ones.  
We appreciate the work and effort of Ken Pomeroy [kenpom.com/](http://kenpom.com/) and [Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/c/march-machine-learning-mania-2017).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
